us.phonetic: /adj., n. ˈmɑdərɪt, ˈmɑdrɪt; v. -əˌreɪt/, (adj., n. mod′ər it, mod′rit; v. mod′ə rāt′)

example.eg: The winters in the area are moderate.
example.egtrans: 该地区的冬季气候比较适中。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 适度的，不过分的, 中等的，普通的，一般的, 适中的

example.eg: Aaron's business was a moderate success.
example.egtrans: 艾伦的公司获得了中等程度的成功。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 中等的, 普通的, 一般的

example.eg: The people elected a moderate candidate, because they were tired of political gridlock.
example.egtrans: 人们厌倦了政治僵局，所以选择了一位温和的竞选人。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不过激的，不激进的，温和的

example.eg: Karen worked to moderate her friend's enthusiasm.
example.egtrans: 凯伦设法让朋友的热情减弱了下去。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使缓和, 减轻, 减弱

example.eg: Tom moderated the online forum personally.
example.egtrans: 汤姆亲自对在线论坛进行规范。

us.phonetic: /adj., n. ˈmɑdərɪt, ˈmɑdrɪt; v. -əˌreɪt/, (adj., n. mod′ər it, mod′rit; v. mod′ə rāt′)

example.eg: In the last election, voters rejected the extremists and elected a moderate.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 温和主义者, 温和派

example.eg: The scientist moderated the neutrons for an experiment.

us.phonetic: /adj., n. ˈmɑdərɪt, ˈmɑdrɪt; v. -əˌreɪt/, (adj., n. mod′ər it, mod′rit; v. mod′ə rāt′)

example.eg: This store offers quality merchandise at a moderate price.
